verses.verse: A psalm written by David when he was fleeing from his son Absalom Yahweh, I have many enemies! There are many people who oppose me.
Many people are saying about me, "God will certainly not help him."
But Yahweh, you are like a shield that protects me. You greatly honor me, and you encourage me.
I cry out to you, Yahweh, and you answer me from Zion, your sacred hill.
At night I lay down and slept, and I woke up in the morning because you, Yahweh, took care of me all during the night.
There may be thousands of enemy soldiers who surround me, but I am not afraid.

Yahweh, arise! My God, come and rescue me again! You will insult my enemies by slapping them on their cheeks; when you strike them, you will destroy their power, with the result that they cannot hurt anyone.
Yahweh, you are the one who saves your people from their enemies. Yahweh, bless your people!
